results.title: Tractor sense
results.creator_credit: John O'Neill, Patrick Pullen and Technical and Scientific Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Safer Farming”.
Gives examples of three fatal accidents with tractors and explains how they could have been avoided if the tractors had been handled properly.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John O’Neill, Patrick Pullen and Technical and Scientific Films

results.title: Tracks on the Oregon trail
results.creator_credit: Christopher Riley and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”
Shows how strong government legislation has been largely responsible for the clean-up of Oregon’s rivers, roadside litter and air pollution problems.
Suitable for middle secondary level.

results.title: Tracker
results.creator_credit: Rex Tasker, ONF | NFB and Kent Nason
results.brief_description: A view from the cockpit of a VS880 Tracker aircraft patrolling Atlantic coastal waters and the eastern Arctic from its base in Shearwater, Nova Scotia. The film is a demonstration of the kind of peacetime missions served by the air arm of the Canadian Armed Forces in protecting territorial waters against illegal incursion and pollution, and in safe-guarding national sovereignty.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Rex Tasker, ONF | NFB and Kent Nason

results.title: Track events
results.creator_credit: Jan Sadlo, George H. Fox and AIMS Instructional Media
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Fundamentals of the Track and Field for Girls”.
This film designed as a teaching tool, emphasizes form and technique. It covers track and field events in girls competition such as: sprints, middle-distance and distance running, hurdles and relays

results.title: Tracing the spread of infection
results.creator_credit: Jack Chambers, Nucleus Film Unit, British Ministry of Health and Michael Clarke
results.brief_description: Contains the only known film records of the phage typing test and the coagulose test. It demonstrates how these tests can be used to trace a strain of staphylococcus back to the source in a human carrier.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jack Chambers, Nucleus Film Unit, British Ministry of Health and Michael Clarke

results.title: Tracey Emin [Widescreen]
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “TheEYE”.
Part of a series of interview-based profiles of contemporary visual artists in Britain - this episode focuses on Tracey Emin whose intelligence, talent and finesse has at times been obscured by her infamy and the controversy that surrounds her highly personalised art. Many of her best-known works, including “Everyone I have ever slept with 1963-1995” (1995) and “My bed” (1998) are startlingly frank as they deal with the intrinsically personal themes in which she engages - autobiography, memory, desire and identity. Discussing her art, and the furore that has often surrounded it, Emin astutely addresses some of the criticisms that have been levelled at her, believing that a part of her success is attributable to timing - her yen for self-examination taps into the zeitgeist of the times when Britain is looking toward individualistic issues, which reflect the space that Emin effortlessly occupies. An illuminating interview with a focused, passionate and intriguing artist, this documentary also contains archival footage of Emin at work and features selections of her blankets, installations, neon art and drawings.
